By  Lacy SearcySeptember  

Counseling Help and Assistance Necessary for College Education or CHANCE students in need of assistance should consider a mentoring program offered by the same office PERIOD

I really want a mentor because I need some advice said Sonserae Boyd a freshman psychology major and CHANCE student PERIOD

The office provides free mentors to any first year CHANCE student that needs advice through the program PERIOD

Mentors must be second year CHANCE students be in good academic standing and be willing to give back to the program said Susana Das Neves head of the mentoring program and CHANCE counselor PERIOD

Mentors are students with good role model skills that can assist new students to adapt to college life basically support and advice from a students perspective Neves said PERIOD

Mentors do not get paid it is strictly volunteer work Neves said PERIOD

CHANCE director Leroy Mitchell said a lot of students come through CHANCE because they were unsuccessful in high school PERIOD It is nice to hook them up with former CHANCE students that were successful he said PERIOD

There are about  students that use the service and  mentors throughout the semester Neves said PERIOD Every mentor works with two to three students PERIOD

Neves assigns mentors to students and the mentors then contact the students to set up a time to meet PERIOD

The CHANCE mentoring program is located in Williston Hall and has been helping students for six years PERIOD The program is certified by the College of Learning and Reading Association Neves said PERIOD

CHANCE is geared toward students who did not have average grade point averages or ACT scores in high school PERIOD The program gives the student another chance to be in school PERIOD

Rosa Campos a Spanish language and literature major and CHANCE mentor said being a mentor is a good experience PERIOD She likes the challenge of helping students because she wants to be a teacher PERIOD
